title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.40 | 09-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: They simply want to please Krishna. That's all.
segments.summary: This segment explains Bhishma Deva's prayer to Krishna, focusing on the Gopis' unparalleled pure devotion characterized by selfless love and a desire only to please Krishna, contrasting it with other forms of worship motivated by personal gain or knowledge.

segments.key_quote: Whereas, the pure devotees do not want anything in return for their worship or in return for their service to Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment differentiates between devotees who approach Krishna with ulterior motives (Artha, Artharthi, Jignasu, Jnani) and pure devotees like the Gopis, who seek nothing in return for their selfless service, highlighting the Gopis' supreme position in devotional service.

segments.key_quote: The Lord, Supreme Lord Krishna, is always more satisfied when his pure devotees are glorified.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Bhishma's aspiration for the Gopis' mercy, their equality with the Lord through perfect ecstasy, and the nature of unconditional love between Krishna and the Gopis, contrasting it with the selfish desire of Mayavadis to merge into God's existence.
